p.span: Itâs that time again!Â Time to Round-Up Kindergarten Students. If you have a student or know of a student who will be attending Kindergarten for 2020-21, please complete the Kindergarten Round-Up registration link below. The information will be used to keep our future NWCS students and parents up to date.
NWCS welcomes those who live out of district!Â If you live out of district please fill out the Transfer Form for 2020-21

span.p: Starting Tuesday April 14, 2020, meals will be distributed two (2) days a week on Tuesday's and Thursday's. Â On Tuesday's, two (2) meals will be distributed and on Thursday, three (3) meals will be distributed. Â

strong.span: Tuesday & Thursday Pick-up: 11:00 AM â 1:00 PM Â

p.span: Ossian Elementary Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Door 6 Â
Lancaster Elementary Â Â Â Door 14 Â
Norwell High SchoolÂ Â Â Â Â Â Â Door 20 Â

If you selected delivery, those meals will be delivered to the address you provided or an alternate location where you were instructed to meet the bus.Â Our bus drivers will be in our smaller white buses so they can pull into driveways.Â If you do not meet them at the bus, they will leave the meals on your front door step.Â Â

If you have dogs outside, our drivers will either leave the meals by the mailbox, on the driveway, or not delivery the meals at all.Â Our drivers have been instructed to use their discretion to maintain their personal safety. Â

Bus delivery will begin at 10 AM.Â It may take up to three hours to deliver all of the meals.Â We apologize, but this is our first attempt.Â If you do not have your meals by 1 PM, please call us at 622-4125 to let us know. Â

h2.span: Pick up your Students' Possessions by May 1st

span.strong: If your child still has belongings in any of our schools, please call Central Office at 260-622-4125 to make arrangements to pick up these items. Â All items must be picked up by the end of the day May 1st.

p.b: Brief update after todayâs Govenorâs press conference:

span.p: School will not return to normal this school year.Â However, NWCS will have to provide 160 days of instruction to our students for the school year.Â Our current calendar accomplishes that.
Seniors who were on track to graduate will.
We are still planning to conduct graduation by some method at some time so we will not change the date for it yet.Â However, we cannot guarantee we will hold in on itâs original date.
High School credit offering classes for Grades 8-11 will continue to completion for awarding credit.
NWCS will have to develop a learning plan due to the DOE April 17th to describe how we will comply with the Stateâs guidelines.
As for a local decision, NWCS facilities will be closed for any non-work related activity for the rest of the year.Â
More guidance will be offered for all of this breaking news in the near future.
